trans-unit.source: Represents a digital signature for an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.

Use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature> instead of <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature> when you work with an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] document.

<xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageDigitalSignature> is not [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)]-aware, and does not guarantee that all parts in an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] document are fully signed.

For more information about digital signatures, see the MSDN article *Digital Signing Framework of the Open Packaging Conventions* available at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=74494](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=74494).

For more information about [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] see the *XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature"></xref> class.
The associated digital signature for the package.
The associated package.
Gets a value that indicates whether changing the properties of the document invalidates the digital signature.
`true` if changing the properties of the document invalidates the signature; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_guid](~/includes/tla2sharptla-guid-md.md)] of the signature.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)] of the signature.
Gets a value that indicates whether the signer's X.509 certificate is contained in the document <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref>.
The X.509 certificate of the signer is embedded by the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally%2A> method when called with the `embedCertificate` parameter set to `true`.

For more information on digital signatures and certificates, see Section 3.3 Digital Signatures in the *Open Packaging Conventions* specification available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
`true` if the X.509 certificate of the signer is embedded in the document <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the digital signature is invalidated if someone else signs the package.

The signature origin restriction is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally%2A> method when called with the `restrictions` parameter set to exclude the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigSigPartAlteringRestrictions.SignatureOrigin> part.

If a document is to be signed by more than one person, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigSigPartAlteringRestrictions.SignatureOrigin> part needs to be excluded from the signature when the document is first signed.

(Exclusions are specified in the `restrictions` parameter of the call to <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally%2A>.) If the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigSigPartAlteringRestrictions.SignatureOrigin> part is not excluded, any additional signatures invalidate the signature of the first signer.

For more information on the Core Properties and Signature Origin parts, see Chapter 3 of the *Open Packaging Conventions* specification available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
`true` if the signature is invalidated if an additional digital signature is applied; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_url](~/includes/tla2sharptla-url-md.md)] string that identifies the signature type.
A [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_url](~/includes/tla2sharptla-url-md.md)] string that identifies the signature type.
The default signature type is <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml.XmlDsigC14NTransformUrl"></xref>.
Gets the encrypted hash value of the signature.
A <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> array that contains the encrypted hash value of the signature.
Gets the document sequence reader for the signed document sequence.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedDocumentSequenceReader"></xref>; or `null` if not all valid [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] parts have been signed in the document.
Gets the X.509 certificate of the signer.
The X.509 certificate of the signer is embedded by the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally%2A> method when called with the `embedCertificate` parameter set to `true`.

For more information on digital signatures and certificates, see Section 3.3 Digital Signatures in the *Open Packaging Conventions* specification available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=71255).
The X.509 certificate of the signer; or `null` when there is no certificate embedded in the document package.
Gets the date and time when the signature was created.
<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature.SigningTime%2A> is based on the system time of the computer where the signing took place.
<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigitalSignature.SigningTime%2A> is not a "secure Time Stamp" and is not from trusted Time Stamp Authority.
A secure TimeStamp must be obtained and applied through a trusted Time Stamp Authority.
The date and time when the pages, document, or document sequence was signed.
Verifies the document digital signature against the X.509 certificate embedded in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.Package"></xref>.

This overload method verifies the document digital signature against the X.509 certificate embedded by the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally%2A> method when called with the `embedCertificate` parameter set to `true`.
One of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult"></xref> enumeration values that specify the result of the verification attempt.
Verifies the document digital signature against a specified X.509 certificate.
The certificate of authenticity for the signer.
One of the <xref href="System.IO.Packaging.VerifyResult"></xref> enumeration values that specify the result of the verification attempt.
Verifies the X.509 certificate embedded in the package.
Your application will need to decide what flags are critical for verifying certificates.
Some certificate verifications may require Internet connectivity.
The X.509 certificate of the signer is embedded by the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally%2A> method when called with the `embedCertificate` parameter set to `true`.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify the result of the verification attempt.
Verifies the specified X.509 certificate.
Your application will need to decide what flags are critical for verifying certificates.
Some certificate verifications may require Internet connectivity.
A certificate of authenticity.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify the result of the verification attempt.
